alert.note: Alert for Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Randolph. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated multiple rounds of heavy rain due to repeat thunderstorms over the same area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Asheboro, North Carolina Zoo and Ulah.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
